summary: This bill, the 'Estate Tax Rate Reduction Act,' proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reduce the estate tax rate to 20%. It modifies sections related to estate, gift, and generation-skipping transfers, aiming to lower the tax burden on estates. The amendments apply to deaths, gifts, and transfers after December 31, 2024. The bill also specifies that its budgetary effects will not be included on certain PAYGO scorecards.
